images.caption: Figure 1:Toy sampling–method comparison.Each panel visualizes both the initial samples (blue) and their corresponding clean data samples (red). From left to right: (A) samples from the original score-based generative model; (B) the target distribution defined by Eq.3; (C) results from SMC; (D) results from MALA+SMC; and (E) results from our proposedΨΨ\Psiroman_Ψ-Sampler.

Figure 2:Qualitative results for each application demonstrate thatΨΨ\Psiroman_Ψ-Samplerconsistently generates images aligned with the given conditions. Detailed analysis of each case is provided in Sec.5.3.
Figure 3:Performance comparison of MALA and pCNL across different evaluation metrics with varying step sizes. Conducted onlayout-to-image generationapplication.

images.caption: Figure 5:Qualitative results for each application on SANA-Sprint[29].

Figure 6:Qualitative results for layout-to-image generation.Examples show how different methods place objects based on input layouts.ΨΨ\Psiroman_Ψ-Sampleraligns well with the given boxes, while baselines often misplace or miss objects.

Figure 7:Qualitative results for quantity-aware image generation.Across various object types and target counts,ΨΨ\Psiroman_Ψ-Samplergenerates the right number of instances more reliably than baseline methods, which tend to over- or under-count.

Figure 8:Qualitative results for quantity-aware image generation.Across various object types and target counts,ΨΨ\Psiroman_Ψ-Samplergenerates the right number of instances more reliably than baseline methods, which tend to over- or under-count.

Figure 9:Qualitative results for aesthetic-preference image generation.ΨΨ\Psiroman_Ψ-Samplerproduces images that are not only realistic but also more visually appealing, with better focus, balance, and overall look compared to baseline outputs.
